programme.title: The Ranakas
programme.desc: 'S1/E4'. A family lunch doesn't go down as planned. Later, Dineo goes on a journey to mend broken relationships.

programme.title: Our Perfect Wedding
programme.desc: 'S14/E4'. Sarah and John met in 1995, and John was attracted to her but could not pursue a relationship because of his friendship with her brother. However, fate brought them together, and they are ready to tie the knot.

programme.title: Date My Family
programme.desc: 'S11/E13'. Tholang Mothabeng, a 36-year-old from Bloemfontein, is a single gay man looking for love. He is looking for someone with whom he will spend the rest of his life.

programme.title: Mzansi Footballers

programme.title: The River
programme.desc: 'S6/E228'. Lindiwe's plan unfolds masterfully. Dimpho and those who stand with her against Lindiwe are horrified by the effects of Lindiwe's testimony.

programme.desc: 'S1/E81'. The plague is claiming lives by the minute. Khosi has a solution to end the plague, but she needs to do something extreme to make it happen. Mthwakazi makes a shocking revelation.

programme.title: Genesis
programme.desc: 'S1/E78'. Felicia makes a shocking announcement that sends everyone into a tailspin. There are no boundaries that a sister's love cannot push. A young star takes a positive step towards getting his life back on track.

programme.title: Ugembula Ngathi
programme.desc: 'S1/E1'. Hlobisile seeks help as her brother's severe gambling addiction and illegal activities threaten both his life and their family's safety.

programme.desc: 'S11/E10 - Utah'. Ben visits Scott Brodie in Utah, who has built an off-grid life in the Canyonlands, and the episode explores Scott's resilience and the 'prepper' mindset.

programme.title: Life Below Zero
programme.desc: 'S10/E16 - Strange New World'. The last few weeks of summer are upon Alaskans, bringing the need for hunting, fishing and harvesting bounty in the Arctic.

programme.title: Inside The Factory
programme.desc: 'S5/E5 - Pasties'. Gregg Wallace is in Cornwall at an enormous bakery where they produce 180,000 Cornish pasties a day. He follows the production of the pastry snacks from the arrival of two tonnes of swedes right through to dispatch.

programme.title: Owl Rescue
programme.desc: 'S1/E10'. Some owls are causing trouble at a mechanics' training centre, others are in a woman's roof and, in a slight change from their usual clients, the Murrays are called to help rescue a baby giraffe.

programme.title: World's Most Scenic Railway Journeys
programme.desc: 'S5/E10 - Australia'. Celebrating the wonders of Queensland, we travel over 1,000 miles from Brisbane to Cairns onboard one of the most advanced trains in the world.

programme.title: Life Below Zero
programme.desc: 'S7/E18 - Beware the Wild'. Sue builds a drainage system under her runway. Ricko explores old family land. Jessie sets up camp in Brushkana. The Hailstones go boating.

programme.title: Where The Wild Men Are With Ben Fogle
programme.desc: 'S10/E1 - Australia'. Ben heads to Australia where he meets Bette, who lives alone in a ramshackle property in northern Queensland. Fogle quickly becomes acquainted with her no-nonsense attitude.

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Danube: Europe's...
programme.desc: 'Joanna Lumley's Danube: Europe's Mightiest River. S1/E1 - Germany and Austria'. Joanna's exploration begins at the river's source, Germany's Black Forest mountains, ends at the Romanian/Ukrainian border, and marks two key anniversaries.

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Danube: Europe's...
programme.desc: 'Joanna Lumley's Danube: Europe's Mightiest River. S1/E2 - Slovakia and Hungary'. Joanna discovers that the 'blue Danube' is both a constant reminder of Europe's unchanging beauty, its past triumphs and current threats.

programme.title: Ben Fogle: Return To The Wild
programme.desc: 'S4/E2 - Revisit: Portugal'. Ben revisits Alex, living in the mountains of central Portugal, discovering Alex has followed his dream of creating a retreat and made significant progress with the infrastructure on his land.

programme.title: Life Below Zero
programme.desc: 'S11/E17 - Run Aground'. Alaskans are in the home stretch of preparing for the upcoming winter.

programme.title: Seven Worlds, One Planet
programme.desc: 'S1/E7 - Africa'. The latest series from the BBC and Sir David Attenborough explores the continent of Africa - home to the greatest wildlife gatherings on Earth. But even in this land of plenty, wildlife faces huge challenges.

programme.title: Where The Wild Men Are With Ben Fogle
programme.desc: 'S10/E2 - California'. A couple from Salt Lake City, Utah, decide to move to the mountainous coast of Shelter Cove, California.

programme.title: Walking With Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 'S1/E5 - The Journey North'. The epic tale of a Pachyrhinosaurus herd, one of the largest dinosaur groups that ever lived, through the eyes of its young member Albie.

programme.desc: 'S1/E7 - Yogyakarta to Surabaya'. Beginning in Java's royal city, Yogyakarta, Michael Portillo visits the Sultan's Palace and witnesses the ancient art of shadow puppetry, known as wayang.

programme.desc: 'S1/E6'. First constructed in the 1930s, the West Side Line - an elevated viaduct section of the New York Central Railroad - was abandoned in the 1980s. But since 2009 it's been totally revitalised.

programme.title: Grade 12 Physical Science
programme.desc: 'S3/E17 - Electrostatics'. In this episode, we will focus on Coulomb's law, electrostatic force, electric fields and two point charges.

programme.title: Grade 12 Physical Science
programme.desc: 'S3/E18 - Current Electricity, Direct Current'. In this episode, we will focus on current, ohm's law revision, emf and internal resistance.

programme.title: Grade 12 Physical Science
programme.desc: 'S3/E19 - Alternating Current'. In this episode, we will focus on motors, generators, alternating currents and electrical power.

programme.title: Grade 12 Physical Science
programme.desc: 'S3/E20 - Optical Phenomena and Properties of material. Photoelectric Effect'. We focus on the photoelectric effect, the threshold frequency of a metal, the work function of a metal, line emissions and absorption spectra.

programme.title: Grade 12 Physical Science
programme.desc: 'S3/E21 - Electrochemical Reactions. Galvanic Cells'. In this episode, we will focus on oxidation numbers, redox equations and reduction oxidation reactions.

programme.title: Grade 12 Physical Science
programme.desc: 'S3/E22 - Electrochemical Reactions. Electrolytic Cells'. In this episode, we will focus on electrolytic cells, comparing electrolytic and galvanic cells, applications of electrolysis and aluminium.

programme.title: Big School Afrikaans
programme.desc: 'S1/E6'. A collection of locally produced animation in the Afrikaans Language aimed at pre school level, made by Africans for Africans.

programme.title: Big School English

programme.title: Big School IsiXhosa

programme.title: Mathematics Teacher Talk
programme.desc: 'S1/E27 - Teaching Statistics'. In this episode, we speak about teaching statistics in Grade 8 and 9. We discuss measures of central tendency and how these ideas can be conveyed effectively.

programme.title: Grade 2 Great Lesson Ideas
programme.desc: 'S1 - Data Handling Episode 1'. A Grade 2 class and teacher help us get lesson ideas during their lesson on Data Handling. This lesson has two episodes.

programme.title: Grade 1 Literacy
programme.desc: 'S3/E12 - Hooray For Handwriting: Capital Letters'. We learn to write capital letters. To get lesson notes on this episode send a whatsapp to +27 60 070 3328 with the code G1T3W3E2.

programme.title: Grade 2 Literacy
programme.desc: 'S3/E12 - Phonics: oi and oy'. We learn to use phonics like oi and oy.

programme.title: Grade 3 Literacy
programme.desc: 'S3/E12 - Pronouns'. We learn to use pronouns.

programme.title: Incremental Introduction of...
programme.desc: 'Incremental Introduction of African Languages (IIAL). S1/E20 - IsiXhosa Lesson 10 Episode 2'. This program aims to offer children a chance to learn the African languages of IsiXhosa and IsiZulu, in a fun and interactive way.

programme.title: Grade 4 Language
programme.desc: 'S3/E12 - Construction of simple sentences'. We learn to construct simple sentences.

programme.title: Grade 5 Language
programme.desc: 'S3/E12 - Deliciously Descriptive Adjectives'. We learn to use adjectives.

programme.title: Grade 6 Language
programme.desc: 'S3/E12 - Using Proper Nouns'. We learn to use proper nouns.

programme.title: Grade 7 Mathematics
programme.desc: 'S3/E12 - Using mathematical language Episode 2'. We learn about using mathematical language. This lesson has two episodes.

programme.title: Grade 7 Natural Science
programme.desc: 'S3/E12 - Potential And Kinetic Energy: Energy Transfers In Mechanical Systems'. We learn about potential and kinetic energy, looking mainly at energy transfers in mechanical systems.

programme.title: Big School English
programme.desc: 'S1/E6'. A collection of locally produced animation aimed at preschool level, made by Africans for Africans.

programme.title: Grade 8 Mathematics
programme.desc: 'S2/E18 - Algebraic Expressions: Collecting Like Terms'. We look at the use of commutative, associative and distributive laws. Add and subtract like terms. Multiply integers and monomials by monomials, binomials and trinomials.

programme.title: Grade 9 Mathematics
programme.desc: 'S3/E55 - Finding the Equation of a Graph'. In this episode, we look at different methods for determining the equation of a straight line.

programme.title: Grade 10 Physical Science

programme.title: Grade 11 Physical Science
programme.desc: 'S2/E16 - Quantitative aspects of chemical change'. In this episode, we will focus on. percentage yield, empirical and molecular formula, ammonium nitrate mining, combustion of petrol, sodium azide reaction and acid base reactions.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Hit The Road
programme.desc: Set out on a journey through Nagasaki, a cultural gateway shaped by tides and time - wander old streets before sailing to Fukue, where ocean vistas and the quiet harmony of distant cultures await.

programme.title: Core Kyoto Mini
programme.desc: In summer, children gather at the street corners where Jizo statues stand for lively festivities - people pray for the health and success of their children during this cornerstone of faith.

programme.title: Easy Japanese For Work
programme.desc: Today: asking others for favours. Warni Letty Yuhara from Indonesia works at a farm in Ibaraki Prefecture - she struggles with others to stay late, so she tackles a role play challenge to improve.

programme.title: Zero Waste Life
programme.desc: Komuro Maito makes dyes from things normally discarded like fruit skins or twigs, but the results are stunning. Colours vary by plant and even by season - as he often says, 'Trash is treasure'.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Somewhere Street
programme.desc: Once a bustling garment district, Sentier is now home to many Internet start-ups and hosts new restaurants, galleries and boutiques that make it a dynamic hub for trendsetting businesses in Paris.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Tradition Inspires A Green Future
programme.desc: Aditya Sharma seeks a sustainable balance between protecting the planet and meeting consumer demand for clothing - he explores a Japanese tradition in the hopes of finding inspiration.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Pianist Sumino Hayato is winning international acclaim for a style that blends various genres while remaining rooted in classical music - he tells us what he hopes to communicate through his art.

programme.title: Where We Call Home
programme.desc: We follow a Ukrainian music duo performing in Nagasaki's Sasebo City and formed by Alek Pashkowski and Vadym Bezvuliak, and Spanish-born Anna Fornieles Orti, who runs a pottery school in Osaka.

programme.title: Easy Travel Japanese
programme.desc: #1 Ii desu ka? (May I?) / When travelling in Japan for the first time, what phrases do you need? Four episodes provide simple expressions that you can put to use as soon as you land.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Kaizoku
programme.desc: The Murakami Kaizoku were seafarers and fighters in the Seto Inland Sea - we explore their history and legacy with footage from time-lapse creator Shimizu Daisuke. This time: Nii Oshima Island.

programme.title: Bosai: Science That Can Save Your Life
programme.desc: Mount Fuji's Threat to Tokyo: Mount Fuji is known for its repeated eruptions - after 300 years of silence, we can expect another eruption soon. Learn how to protect yourself from volcanic disasters.

programme.title: Activate Your Japanese
programme.desc: Learn how to make the most of your Japanese skills - watch our drama that features useful communication strategies, our snappy videos about onomatopoeia, and our documentaries on 'senpai' in Japan.

programme.title: Bosai: Be Prepared
programme.desc: Practical knowledge to save yourself from natural disaster - in this episode, we learn how to evacuate from floods and rainstorms.

programme.title: Hello! NHK World-Japan
programme.desc: We introduce NHK's live international coverage of Japan's Upper House election which took place in July 2025 - we go behind the scenes and see NHK's crew rehearsing until the very last minute.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Seasoning The Seasons
programme.desc: This programme visits places across Japan to introduce the charms of their local daily life and festivals fostered by the nation's long history.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Biz Stream
programme.desc: From finding business successors to preserving prized recipes, this episode focuses on ensuring the survival of companies and products that are at risk of disappearing.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Hometown Stories
programme.desc: Kiriake Chieko helped cremate schoolmates after the atomic bombing in Hiroshima - at 95, as the oldest surviving witness, she continues to give her testimony urging people to hold on dearly to peace.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Enomoto Megumi opened free learning centres modelled on traditional Japanese temple schools to provide education for disadvantaged children in Mozambique - she talks about breaking the poverty cycle.

programme.title: Passing The Torch Of Peace
programme.desc: Ari Beser's grandfather served on the planes that dropped atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki - Harada Kosuzu's grandfather survived both. Now they are fighting for a world without nuclear weapons.

programme.title: Passing The Torch Of Peace
programme.desc: The key to achieving peace is feeling the pain of others - it's an idea Hayashida Mitsuhiro picked up from hibakusha in his native Nagasaki, and one he tries to teach young visitors to his city.

programme.title: Ukiyo-e Edo-Life
programme.desc: A Bedtime Routine: On hot and humid summer nights, nothing can get in the way of sleep like mosquitoes, we learn about the tools Edo townspeople had at their disposal to fight these pesky insects.

programme.desc: The key to achieving peace is feeling the pain of others - it's an idea Hayashida Mitsuhiro picked up from hibakusha in his native Nagasaki, and one he tries to teach young visitors to his city.

programme.title: Ukiyo-e Edo-Life
programme.desc: A Bedtime Routine: On hot and humid summer nights, nothing can get in the way of sleep like mosquitoes, we learn about the tools Edo townspeople had at their disposal to fight these pesky insects.

programme.title: The A-Bomb Experience
programme.desc: In a world with 10,000 nuclear weapons and endless conflict, what if an atomic bomb were dropped? This show visualises the A-bomb's impact through a man's testimony of being exposed in Hiroshima.

programme.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat Of Japan
programme.desc: Yoshida Ryusei, an October matsuri, features rockets called ryusei that are made by local teams and carry community prayers high in the sky - team members pour heart and soul into their efforts.

programme.title: Seasoning The Seasons
programme.desc: This programme visits places across Japan to introduce the charms of their local daily life and festivals fostered by the nation's long history.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Medical Frontiers
programme.desc: Researchers in Japan are gathering scientific evidence on the effects of acupuncture and moxibustion - we examine how they improve stroke aftereffects, atopic dermatitis and other issues.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Where We Call Home
programme.desc: We follow a Ukrainian music duo performing in Nagasaki's Sasebo City and formed by Alek Pashkowski and Vadym Bezvuliak, and Spanish-born Anna Fornieles Orti, who runs a pottery school in Osaka.

programme.title: Easy Travel Japanese
programme.desc: #1 Ii desu ka? (May I?) / When travelling in Japan for the first time, what phrases do you need? Four episodes provide simple expressions that you can put to use as soon as you land.

programme.title: Activate Your Japanese

programme.title: Bosai: Be Prepared
programme.desc: Practical knowledge to save yourself from natural disaster - in this episode, we learn how to evacuate from floods and rainstorms.

programme.title: Hello! NHK World-Japan
programme.desc: We introduce NHK's live international coverage of Japan's Upper House election which took place in July 2025 - we go behind the scenes and see NHK's crew rehearsing until the very last minute.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Hometown Stories
programme.desc: Kiriake Chieko helped cremate schoolmates after the atomic bombing in Hiroshima - at 95, as the oldest surviving witness, she continues to give her testimony urging people to hold on dearly to peace.

programme.title: Easy Japanese
programme.desc: #41 Can we buy tickets? / To ask someone if you can do something, say the verb to indicate your desired action followed by 'koto ga' and 'dekimasu', meaning something is possible, finally, add 'ka'.
